text:
GM Lobsters. Some of you may know that @lebed2045 and I have been working on a new protocol. And camrade @nakamotocat suggested I reach out to this group.

We're starting a quiet rollout of StableUnit on BSC and are looking for some sharp eyes on UX/flows and edge cases.
The protocol has two products in one: a passive-income non-rebasing stablecoin and lending protocol that supports LP as collateral.

If you want in early, react here or DM me. Happy to reimburse a few bucks of gas for solid notes (steps, screenshots). Also DAO may recognize you a bit later ;)

I'm not posting the link here directly because I don't want to get banned or eat shit. But I could after admin approve :)

I donâ€™t even know how to answer to this. 

Why isnâ€™t 512kb internet connection enough?

Chasing web2-level UX does not work with block times over 100ms (even that might be way too slow).

You have to multiply any write action you want to make by 2-4 to get to the actual end user experienced latency as you have to wait for (pre-)confirmation and sometimes you transactions donâ€™t get included in the block you try.

Ok please take US visa discussions to kingdom or DMs. Not polluting the chat with the american government slop

(no mutes, nw, justâ€¦ enough)
1099 won't help foreign devs work or live in America legally though.
There will be other ways of getting highly skilled people in.
The plan is to stop the h1b program which was rampant with fraud.

Sir I'm not even a US citizen just want to know what the plans of US based companies are. I believe it does even not apply to current holders just new applications. 

1099 are certain payments made to non-employees, such as freelance or contract work. Much better for the Co but not for the employee necessarily( It could be better for both though after the regs kick in)  

What I meant is DEVs can still likely be hired as 1099s
Circumvented? How about just hiring your brothers in Christ, instead of trying to minmax more foreigners in like some trafficker

https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/09/restriction-on-entry-of-certain-nonimmigrant-workers/

New H-1B Visa regulations. 

Seems it will really hurt the tech/crypto sector in the US.  Maybe can be circumvented via 1099s but it could be a risky regulatory environment
